meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Bob Mesch Lori Reichart Dan Green Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #374.

td.p: Bob Mesch, a counselor-tutor from San Diego, California
Dan Green, a teacher from Las Vegas, Nevada (whose 2-day cash winnings total $18,800)

tr.td: HOTELS
POLITICAL TRIVIA
WASHINGTON STATE
FAIRIES & WEE FOLK
#1 SONGS
"LIFE"

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_5_4', 'clue_J_5_4_stuck', '[Bob gives his response before the song proper starts playing. The singing continues under his and Alex\'s conversation.]
(Alex: You don\'t even want to hear his alma mater.)
(Bob: Not especially.)
(Alex: The song was "My Ding-A-Ling", but you get $500 for identifying [*]. Save that music and play it as we go into the commercial break please.)
[The song reprises as they go to commercial.]
...
[Note: Alex read the word "Amazingly" at the beginning of the clue, but it did not appear on the onscreen Chyron.]

Chuck Berry

Bob
')
div.onmouseout:
toggle('clue_J_5_4', 'clue_J_5_4_stuck', 'Amazingly this immortal rocker didn\'t have a no. 1 hit until 1972, w/ following:

We got the new alma mater,
We must do our alma mater.

When I was...')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td:
Amazingly this immortal rocker didn't have a no. 1 hit until 1972, w/ following:
We got the new alma mater,
We must do our alma mater.
When I was...

toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: He was in the news a great deal in 1985.)
...
(Alex: [to Lori] I think he probably made the cover of Wheaties when he was still an amateur.)
BobWho was John McEnroe
$600
DanWho is Pete Rose?
$3,000
LoriWho was Bruce Jenner?
$2,900
Pete Rose')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'In 1985, this person became the 1st professional athlete ever to appear on the front of a Wheaties box')

tr.td: FAMOUS NAMES
In 1985, this person became the 1st professional athlete ever to appear on the front of a Wheaties box
Dan
Lori
Bob
3-day champion: $24,800
2nd place: Hero Jr. personal robot + Joy games carpet
3rd place: Frigidaire laundry center
Dan
Lori
Bob

17 R,
4 W
(including 2 DDs)

7 R
(including 1 DD),

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans.
